intro: Myriocladus paruensis, commonly known as the Paruensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
